speaker: Barkeep
lines: The barkeep wipes the counter in steady circles.
He sets down a glass with the care of a man who has seen long nights.
'You look like a question,' he says. 'I've got a few answers.'
He holds up three fingers. 'And a cellar.'
The mirror behind the bar shows the room without its noise.
A ledger sits open in the dim; debts wait where they were left.
Barrels line the wall by the back door.
The tap hisses; the cask is fresh.
